item.title: Millions of public sector workers to get pay rise
item.description: PM Rishi Sunak says the offer to workers was final and that there would be "no more talks on pay".

item.title: Junior doctors in England start five-day strike
item.description: Thousands of operations and appointments cancelled as junior doctors in England begin a five-day walkout.

item.title: Greek coastguard 'pressured' disaster survivors to blame Egyptian men
item.description: New evidence further challenges the official version of last month's deadly sinking.

item.title: Feeling the 'Kenergy' on Barbie movie pink carpet
item.description: Stars from the hotly-anticipated film attend its premiere in London's Leicester Square.

item.title: Dele Alli: Everton midfielder says he was sexually abused aged six
item.description: Everton midfielder Dele Alli says he was sexually abused when he was six years old and started dealing drugs aged eight.

item.title: UK economy 'listless' with little growth in four years
item.description: The economy shrank by 0.1% in May and has barely grown since 2019 before the pandemic.

item.title: Cerberus heatwave: Hot weather sweeps across southern Europe
item.description: The heatwave could potentially lead to record-breaking temperatures, forecasters say.

item.title: Warning public debt could soar as population ages
item.description: Debt could rise to more than 300% of the size of the economy by 2070, the government's forecaster says.

item.title: Ukraine war: Russian general fired after criticising army leaders
item.description: Gen Ivan Popov says he refused to keep quiet over issues at the front line in Ukraine.

item.title: Sudan conflict: 87 people found in Darfur mass grave, UN says
item.description: There are concerns the RSF is targeting specific ethnic groups in the West Darfur region.

item.title: Mortgage rates: 'I have Â£50,000 but can't buy a house'
item.description: Young people say buying feels hopeless and they are penalised as renters are unable to save.

item.title: Manipur: Murders and mayhem tearing apart an Indian state
item.description: Ethnic divisions in Manipur have led to complete segregation of the warring communities.

item.title: James Webb telescope image dazzles on science birthday
item.description: The space observatory delivers a fascinating view of starbirth to mark one year of operations.

item.title: Nato: Warm words but a diplomatic reality check for Ukraine
item.description: President Zelensky wants assurances Ukraine will join Nato after the war, but members chose strategic caution.

item.title: The fight over a Confederate statue in Arlington National Cemetery
item.description: A Confederate memorial in Arlington National Cemetery is coming down. But what happens next?

item.title: Danish vlogger: 'My guilt over being traded in Iranian prisoner swap'
item.description: Thomas Kjems was one of four Europeans freed in exchange for an Iranian diplomat jailed in Belgium.

item.title: The firms giving nature a stake in their businesses
item.description: Some companies are giving shares to environmental groups, or putting such advocates on their board.

item.title: Taylor Swift fan says her Speak Now vinyl contains 'cursed' electronic music
item.description: A British fan got a creepy surprise when she opened her copy of Taylor Swift's latest album.

item.title: Miss Netherlands: Transgender model 'broke boundaries' with beauty pageant win
item.description: Rikkie Valerie Kolle has made history as the first transgender woman to win Miss Netherlands.

item.title: The mega-strike that could take down Hollywood
item.description: Actors prepare to join writers on the picket lines, shutting down TV and film productions.

item.title: How torn ears are preserving a rare culture in Alaska
item.description: How the traditions of the hunt from hundreds of years before live on in an unusual annual sporting event in Alaska.

item.title: Cat Burns on autism, ADHD and a lack of research
item.description: The singer opens up about being diagnosed as a black woman and why she wants more research to be done.

item.title: Barbie movie: How the marketing campaign has got everyone talking
item.description: Film critic Ali Plumb and a marketing expert explain why the Barbie film has been everywhere for months.

item.title: In pictures: Cerberus heatwave hits parts of Europe
item.description: People in countries including Italy and Spain are struggling to cope with soaring temperatures.

item.title: Women's World Cup: How 'fiery' Chloe Kelly became England star
item.description: A year ago, Chloe Kelly was on the bench waiting for her moment to shine at Euro 2022 - now she is heading to the World Cup as an England star.

item.title: Watch: North Korean state TV shows latest missile launch
item.description: State media has broadcast a video of Wednesdayâs intercontinental ballistic missile launch.

item.title: Hundreds of golden retrievers gather in Highlands
item.description: The dogs and their owners are marking 155 years since the breed's first litter was born.

item.title: Mortgage payments set to jump by Â£500 for one million households
item.description: Bank of England says higher interest rates are yet to hit many homes but lenders are proving resilient.

item.title: Revamped Burrell Collection wins Museum of the Year
item.description: The Glasgow attraction secured the Â£120,000 Art Fund award - the largest museum prize in the world.

item.title: Emmy nominations 2023: The Last of Us and Succession up for top TV awards
item.description: Ted Lasso, The White Lotus, Wednesday and Abbott Elementary are among the other nominees.

item.title: Women's Ashes: England level Ashes after tense ODI win
item.description: Watch as England levelled the Women's Ashes series with a two-wicket victory over Australia in Bristol in the first ODI of the series.

item.title: Mark Cavendish says he is all good' after surgery on broken collarbone
item.description: Mark Cavendish says it will take "a few weeks" to recover after having surgery on a broken collarbone that ended his Tour de France.

item.title: Wimbledon 2023: Jamie Murray on missing another title chance at All England Club
item.description: In his BBC Sport column at Wimbledon, British doubles star Jamie Murray talks about losing another opportunity to achieve his biggest career goal.

item.title: 'She's just an off-spinner' - England demystify Australia
item.description: Kate Cross reflects on England's remarkable Ashes turnaround after the hosts' two-wicket win in the first one-day international in Bristol.

item.title: Who is BBC presenter Huw Edwards?
item.description: The presenter has been named as the BBC star at the centre of a string of damaging allegations in the Sun.

item.title: 'This is such dramatic news' - Katie Razzall
item.description: BBC News Culture and Media Editor talks about Huw Edwards after he is named as the star at the centre of allegations.

item.title: The Huw Edwards story so far... in 87 seconds
item.description: The presenter faced pressure to identify himself after almost a week of allegations in the media.

item.title: Wife Vicky Flind's statement in full
item.description: The wife of Huw Edwards issues a statement on his behalf, naming him as the BBC newsreader facing allegations.

item.title: How the allegations unfolded
item.description: Allegations and speculation about a BBC presenter's behaviour and identity had mounted for days.

item.title: What is GDP and how is it measured?
item.description: A basic guide to how the economy is measured and what that calculation is used for.

item.title: What is a recession and how could it affect me?
item.description: Britain's economy is expected to shrink in 2023 but no longer expected to go into recession.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is it so high?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising remains high, driven by soaring food prices.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: Mortgages: What happens if I am struggling to pay?
item.description: Many homeowners are worried about higher mortgage costs, but lenders must help those struggling.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: With interest rates rapidly rising, what do experts say about coping with costs?

item.title: Mortgage calculator: how much will my mortgage go up?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much mortgage payments could go up for your household.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.
